Imagine you are fascinated by a topic! In order to master a topic, you pound through a pile of books, articles or any other form of artifacts. You feel good about your understanding of that topic. It makes you feel intelligent and are ready to move on to other topics that captures your mind.

After six months later, you meet your best friend and try to explain what you had learned a few months ago. But, you miss some key facts about that topic. Now you are just sharing your opinions. So this begs the question of how can we intelligently share facts over opinions? By the way, I am a victim of this hypothetical scenario and I constantly observe this happening around me.
